page.title: 01Kirbister Smoogro Hobbister
page.content: 1/4 of this square is sea. Lobster fisherman set creels aroung Smoogro Skerry and Ve Ness. A project, run by Dundee University Marine Biology Unit, to assess environmental change on various shell fish, is underway at the Lash. Trout fishing is a popular sport on Kirbister Loch. This Loch supplies much of Orkney with its water. Built in 1966 Kirbister Water Pumping it to various storeage tanks. Approximately 2/3 of the land is hill ground, a large portion of which is the RSPB Hobbister Bird Reserve, creating a safe breeding place for many otherwise endangered birds including the Hen Harrier. Peat is cut each year on the hill ground, in some cases, in recent years, by machine. The remaining land is mainly arable farm land. buildings include a thriving farm machinery business, a
